title: Ticket #7516: S3 file transfer needs accurate error messaging
description:
Currently, any error with s3 file transfers (credentials not found, invalid credentials, invalid URL, etc) all result in the same generic catch-all hold message:

FILETRANSFER: plugin for type s3 not found!

It is possible to look up the correct error message in the ShadowLog, but this is very misleading to users, as well as developers. We should fix this so the errors that show up in the StarterLog and hold messages are accurate.
remarks:
2020-Feb-21 16:03:02 by tlmiller:
In particular -- and this doesn't cover all the problem cases -- it's infuriating when the shadow log says 

02/21/20 15:58:47 (903.0) (3805): DoUpload: Will sign s3://aws-chtc-development-2.s3-us-east-2.amazonaws.com/initial-aws-account-instructions for remote transfer.
02/21/20 15:58:47 (903.0) (3805): DoUpload: Failed to sign URL - AWS SigV4:3:Invalid format for domain-based buckets.  Must be of the form s3://<bucket>.s3.<region>.amazonaws.com/<object>
...
02/21/20 15:58:47 (903.0) (3805): DoUpload: sending file s3://aws-chtc-development-2.s3-us-east-2.amazonaws.com/initial-aws-account-instructions
02/21/20 15:58:47 (903.0) (3805): DoUpload: sending s3://aws-chtc-development-2.s3-us-east-2.amazonaws.com/initial-aws-account-instructions as URL.
...

Which is to say that the shadow knew it was an S3 URL, failed to sign it, and then decided to give the S3 plug-in a try. This seems stupid, and made worse by not checking to see if the putative plug-in is available.

2020-Feb-21 16:09:43 by tlmiller:
There's another problem where uploading to the wrong region will not be reported as a failure but of course doesn't succeed. I believe this is the upload side of #7292, and we can more-or-less just cut-and-paste the solution.

2020-Feb-26 15:01:49 by tlmiller:
BrianB says that there's no good reason -- especially now that the code has been proven to mostly work -- to try and use an admin-defined fallback instead of just failing. He further points out that it might be wise to send something in the reply ClassAd indicating failure to make sure that the clean-up is orderly (as opposed to having the shadow put the job on hold and just close the socket on its way out the door).

2020-Feb-27 15:41:11 by tlmiller:
This patch only addresses the issues that can be detected before trying to download the pre-signed URLs. (On the other hand, once we get to trying to download the pre-signed URLs, we shouldn't be seeing the plug-in message any more, so maybe there should be a child ticket for properly reporting problems that happen with downloads?)

(I'll let Mark work on those issues, since he knows the curl plugin.)
